questions.question: There are ................................... people I can’t stand.
questions.description: We use some in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: Is there ....................................... to do?
questions.description: Any, anything, anyone etc., are used in questions and negative sentences.

questions.question: I have .................................... doubts.
questions.description: We use some, someone, something etc., in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: I would like ...................................... to help me with this.
questions.description: We use some, someone, something etc., in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: Have you got ………………………….. problem?
questions.description: Any, anything, anyone etc., are used in questions and negative sentences.

questions.question: She doesn't do ………………………...
questions.description: Any, anything, anyone etc., are used in questions and negative sentences.

questions.question: I don't need .................................... advice.
questions.description: Any, anything, anyone etc., are used in questions and negative sentences.

questions.question: Let’s eat ……………………….. Shall we?
questions.description: We use some, someone, something etc., in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: I have read ………………………….. books on this subject.
questions.description: We use some, someone, something etc., in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: Have you got …………………………… razors?
questions.description: Any, anything, anyone etc., are used in questions and negative sentences.

questions.question: I haven’t got ……………………… idea how this happened.
questions.description: Any, anything, anyone etc., are used in questions and negative sentences.
